definition: lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
medical/medicine/doctor/to cure/to treat

sentences.english: Weight control is difficult for me. I fight the losing battle.
sentences.chinese: 控制体重对于我来说很难，我是死马当活马医啊。

sentences.english: Advance the idea of just desperate for any horse medicine it.
sentences.chinese: 事前的想法只是死马当活马医吧。

sentences.english: Alan was clutching at straws when he took his dying wife to another doctor.
sentences.chinese: 子带去看另一位医生，那是在把死马当活马医。

sentences.english: You can die Madang live Ma admitted free to play.
sentences.chinese: 您大可死马当活马医，随意发挥。

definition: to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to have a try
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to give it a try
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
a gleam of hope

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: lit. to smash a cracked pot (idiom); crazy despair in the face of a blemish, defect, error or setback
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
half doubting/dubious/skeptical
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
a blind cat finds a dead mouse (idiom)/blind luck
pinyin: xia1 mao1 peng4 shang4 si3 hao4 zi5

definition: unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
to bring back to life
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
